title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

f ′  ( x )= 3 x 2 − x 3 e x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@473A@ earns the first 2 points.

An unlabeled correct f ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E08@ earns the first 2 points.

To earn the first point:

· If the quotient rule was used, the presented derivative must include a sum or difference, a factor of e x , MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGLbWaaWbaaSqabeaacaWG4baaaOGaaiilaaaa@3BC8@ and a polynomial in each term of the numerator.

· If the product rule was used, the presented derivative must include a factor of e −x MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGLbWaaWbaaSqabeaacqGHsislcaWG4baaaaaa@3BFB@ in each term.

A response that includes f ′  ( x )= e x  ⋅ 3 x 2 − x 3 e x e x 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5240@ earns the first point, does not earn the second point, and is eligible for the third point. In this case the response must correctly evaluate this expression at x=5, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGynaiaacYcaaaa@3C6C@ and use the resulting value as the slope of the tangent line.

The second point cannot be earned without the first. The second point is earned for a correct expression for f ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E07@ or a correct value of f ′  ( 5 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E7B@

A response that labels the values f ( 5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DBE@ and f ′  ( 5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DCA@ correctly with no other supporting work does not earn the first 2 points but is eligible for the third point.

A response that presents a correct f ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E07@ but an incorrect f ′  ( 5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DCA@ earns the first 2 points, but does not earn the third point.

A response that presents a correct equation of the tangent line with no supporting work earns no points in this part.

A response with any arithmetic error in f ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E07@ does not earn the third point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

lim x→∞ f ( x )=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4977@ or lim x→∞ x 3 e x =0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4910@ earns the point.

A response that presents an expression, rather than an equation, does not earn the point.

A response that presents any additional incorrect limits does not earn the point.
descriptions:
The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.

· Equation

The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

· Equation

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

( 3 x 2 − x 3 )=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41CE@ earns the first point.

A response that presents only one of x=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGimaaaa@3BB7@ or x=3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaG4maaaa@3BBA@ along with correct answer and justification earns 1 of the last 2 points.

A response that lists additional values of x as critical points does not earn either of the last 2 points.

The second derivative may be used to justify the relative maximum at x=3. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaG4maiaac6caaaa@3C6C@ Since f ″ (x)=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E0A@ at x=0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGimaiaacYcaaaa@3C67@ it is not sufficient to use the second derivative to conclude that x=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGimaaaa@3BB7@ is neither a maximum or minimum value; more justification is needed.

A sign chart with no explanation is not sufficient justification.

Because the interval is not closed, the Extreme Value Theorem may not be used.

A response that imports e x 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BF8@ in the denominator of the derivative from part (a) is eligible for all 3 points.

A response that imports either f ′  ( x )= e x  ⋅ 3 x 2 + x 3 e x ( e x ) 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@53E6@ or f ′  ( x )= −  e x  ⋅ 3 x 2 + x 3 e x ( e x ) 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5664@ from part (a) is eligible for all 3 points.

· An import of f ′  ( x )= e x  ⋅ 3 x 2 + x 3 e x ( e x ) 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@53E6@ should find critical points x=−3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaeyOeI0IaaG4maaaa@3CA7@ and x=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGimaaaa@3BB7@ AND conclude that f has a relative minimum at x=−3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CC7@ and neither a minimum nor a maximum at x=0. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C89@

· An import of f ′  ( x )= −  e x  ⋅ 3 x 2 + x 3 e x ( e x ) 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5664@ should find critical points x=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGimaaaa@3BB7@ and x=3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaG4maaaa@3BBA@ AND conclude that f has neither a minimum nor a maximum at x=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaIWaaaaa@3BD7@ and a relative minimum at x=3. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C8C@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

A factor of 1 6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWcaaqaaiaaigdaaeaacaaI2aaaaaaa@3A85@ is not needed to earn the first point.

The definite integral can be presented in a single or multiple steps to earn the first point. For example, the following response earns both points: ∫ f ′  ( x )  dx =f ( x ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4BE1@ so the average value is 1 6 ( 125 e 5 + 1 e −1 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@457C@

f ( 5 )−f ( −1 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4477@ earns the first point and 1 6 ( 125 e 5 −( −1 e −1 ) ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47E5@ earns both points, provided there are no subsequent errors in simplification.

A response that presents a correct integral along with the correct average value, but provides incorrect or incomplete communication, earns 1 out of 2 points. For example, the following response earns 1 out of 2 points: ∫  −1 5 f ′  ( x )  dx =( 125 e 5 +e )= 1 6 ( 125 e 5 +e ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5CC5@

∫ −1 5 f ′  ( x )  dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@474F@ with an incorrect f ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E08@ imported from part (a) or part (c) earns the first point.

A response with incorrect limits earns no points.

A response of 1 6  ⋅  125 e 5 − −1 e −1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A0E@ or 1 6  ⋅ f ( 5 )−f ( 1 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4AB7@ earns the first point but not the second point.

A response that uses an incorrect value of f ( 5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DBE@ or f ( −1 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EA7@ does not earn the second point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.
